job_title: Grant Writer in Alamosa, CO
pros: Great communication, very supportive higher ups, availability to transfer to different departments within the organization, education perks (scholarships/grants/loans), very supportive of staff during COVID.
cons: Pay is a little low compared to other jobs in the area

job_title: Dental Assistant in Monte Vista, CO
pros: Good benefits. Pay is competitive.
cons: No recognition. Managements way or no way. No bonuses.

job_title: FNP-BC in La Junta, CO
pros: I like rural medicine, the atmosphere is very friendly
cons: Not enough licensed nursing staff and I feel working with medical assistants and certified nursing assistance is a hinderance

job_title: Dental Assistant in Alamosa, CO
pros: Pay is great , Benefits and training
cons:
Management is very hard to communicate with , lack of coordination no matter how much is tried to have a change , Management is very short tempered and will give unpleasant, Gossip does happen between management and from desk employee . Nothing can remain private if something is going with you personally
or if you miss a day. Management expects employees to clean and get rid of expired products the day before AAA shows up , some expired products are used on patients Sadly great pay but needs work

job_title: Registered Nurse in Alamosa, CO
pros: Great support staff, hard-working providers
cons: Leadership is out of tune with current practices, with no willingness to do things better for patients, executives are more concerned with quantity, not quality. Has the most underpaid nurses in the state. Most staff is burned out. The patriarch system is alive and well here.

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Alamosa, CO
pros: Employee benefits are good, generous leave time.
cons: Favoritism, nepotism, unqualified people in key positions. What you know doesn't matter, no regard for longevity or commitment.

job_title: Dental Assistant in Monte Vista, CO
pros: Working close to home was nice.
cons: The pay, management’s lack of knowledge of the dental field, and the immaturity of supervisors.

review_title: Small company with a big heart
job_title: Director of Operations in Alamosa, CO
pros:
Corporate mission is encompassed by the entire staff who are all focused on keeping VWHS a successful community health care center.
Employee expectations based on behavioral standards created by the entire staff.
cons: VWHS has had the same senior management for 20 - 30 years, which does not allow for significant growth and change.  Recent management changes give promise to corporate growth and improvement.

review_title: Didn't care for the company overall as a whole. Management just didn't have all of their ducks in a row.
job_title: Administrative Associate in Winchester, VA
pros: Flexible schedule, unlimited opportunity for advancement
cons: Management was not the best, could never get someone to actually sit down and talk with you, they really don't care about their employee's at all.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Canon City, CO
pros: Integrated system including case management and behavioral health
cons: Long hours and lacking support staff
